t: Psalm 115
Glory to God Alone
Not*pn to us, Lord,*s not to us, but*ln to your name give glory because*ln of your faithful love, because of your truth.
Why*ln should the nations say, “Where*ln is their God?”
Our*ln God is in heaven and*ln does whatever he pleases.
Their*pn idols are silver and gold, made*ln by human hands.
They*ln have mouths but cannot speak, eyes,*ln but cannot see.
They*ln have ears but cannot hear, noses,*ln but cannot smell.
They*ln have hands but cannot feel, feet,*ln but cannot walk. They*ln cannot make a sound with their throats.
Those*ln who make them are just like them, as*ln are all who trust in them.
Israel,*pn trust in the Lord!*s He*ln is their help and shield.

The*ln Lord*s remembers us and will bless us. He*ln will bless the house of Israel; he*ln will bless the house of Aaron;

But*ln we will bless the Lord,*s both*ln now and forever. Hallelujah!*ln
